result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D. Hamilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Eau Claire County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
**No credit, if revoked** 
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: 21CF1021

To be determined within 60 days. Plus 10% surcharge.
05/02/2022: Per order dated 4/25/22  Restitution is now $0.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nicholas D. Hamilton

records.addlTxt: Letter sent to defendant regarding DOC to COC Collects.
AMENDED - Restitution now $0 - Clerk of Courts to Collect.

Amendment to Judgment of Conviction.
Restitution -0- None Requested

(Cases 22CF139, 21CM732, 21CF1021 are called at 10:23 AM - by Zoom) Prosecuting attorney DA Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Nicholas D. Hamilton appeared by video, in custody from Clark County Jail.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Nicholas D. Hamilton. 
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver in 22CF139, 21CF1021. Defendant waives right to personal appearance. State recites the joint sentence recommendation. Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Defendant pleads Guilty to 21CF1021 Count 1- Possession of Methamphetamine, 22CF139 Count 1- Felony Retail Theft, and 21CM732 Count 1- Misdemeanor Retail Theft. Court accepts pleas and finds the Defendant guilty. Remaining charges are dismissed and read in. 
Court withholds sentence in 21CF1021 and 22CF139 and orders 2 years Probation with the following conditions: 90 days jail with Huber on Count 1 in 21CF1021, all stayed pending further order of the court; No contact with Walmart; Restitution in 22CF139 to be determined within 60 days; Maintain absolute sobriety; Any conditions, programming or treatment per the agent and follow through with recommendations; Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge; Court costs. 3 days credit, if revoked in 21CF1021 and no credit, if revoked in 22CF139. 
Court orders in 21CM732- Defendant pay Restitution in the amount of $58.98 plus 10% surcharge payable to the clerk of courts office to be paid in full within 6 months, Provide DNA sample, pay the surcharge, and Court costs.

9:37 AM cases 22CF139, 21CM732, 21CF1021 called and held via Zoom. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Nicholas D. Hamilton appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Roger M Hillestad appeared in court for Nicholas D. Hamilton. 
In 22CF139: Waives reading of the complaint and time limits for the preliminary hearing. 
All files: Pre-Trial Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 3-14-22 at 1:30 PM. 
A hearing is scheduled for 4-5-22 at 9:30 AM.
